newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest direct hogs steady-off $1 - dealers.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest direct hogs steady-off $1 - dealers.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct hog prices early Tuesday were steady to $0.50 per cwt, instances $1.00 lower amid continued light demand as some packers maintain lighter slaughter schedules, livestock dealers said.
At least one major packer indicated it would operate six- to six-and-a-half-hour shifts all week, they said.
Slaughter was reduced Monday when margins narrowed amid higher hog prices last week and sluggish pork demand, industry sources and packer spokesmen said.
Interior Iowa and southern Minnesota hogs sold $0.50 lower, with a $55.50 country top and $56.50 at plants.
